text:
Im looking for documentation on the *hbspt.form* object.
I just want a list of the methods available.
for example *hbspt.forms.create()*
Please help meh.
I checked <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/v2/create_form>
I actually switched to another gem, problem solved :stuck_out_tongue:

Hey <@UUG57S9MG>
may be this helps you
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/global-form-events>

I’m looking for ways to integrate the navigation between our main website and HubSpot, is there a way to get navigation in json format, or get the module that renders the navigation in html format?  I’m not particularly concerned whether our website owns the navigation, or HubSpot owns it, as long as it can be shared so that it’s always in sync.  Preference at the moment would be to manage all navigation within HubSpot, and then grab it from our current site
You could build the menu object into a json array

Do you mean statically maintain a json array somewhere?  How would this be shared externally?  I’d like to maintain our authoring experience so that our SME’s are encouraged to maintain their own content
<@UR15MFU2V> Yes that was it! Thank you!
Hi guys, I want to get the fields of a form using vanila javascript but it gives me a No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested requested resource, any recommended tutorial?
can you provide the url you are doing this on? it sounds like you may be trying to access a form inside an iframe
yeah, not sure if you can do that as you wouldn't save your api key in a js file that could be read, that is why they prevent CORS requests. that would be publishing your api key....
What are you trying to accomplish doing this? Like why are you calling the from api from a website page, and what are you trying to do with it?

This is a test to see how the api works, what I would like is to be able to add new elements to a HubSpot property that works as a dropdown from an external platform with an ajax call with the post method

To use the form api you are going to need to make a backend call so that it the api key isn't published. So if you would have that avialable to you (or a serverless function) to make this work, then that will work for you.

That being said, if you are testing on what comes back from the api, using postman might be something to help you figure out what it returns without having to setup  call from the other platform

for the final result you'll need your ajax call to hit a serverless function or something else where the api key is stored so that it isn't available to people searcing the html/code as that is a sercurity risk, allowing other people your api key would allow them to delete all your stuff, modify it, or just add in nonsense
Of course previously I have been able to add contacts with the forms api, but in this case from the backend how could I modify a property (dropdown) of a form with new values
thanks for your answers!
I think you would need to modify the actual property, meaning you would use the contact properties api <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/v2/update_contact_property>

Hi Guys, This question is about Associations API. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-associations/crm-associations-overview>

IS there a way to get access to ALL “Associations” instead of calling following for each individual objectID.

“/crm-associations/v1/associations/*:objectId*/HubSpot_DEFINED/:definitionId”
hi all, is there any api to import file of contacts and its properties?
the closest one is, but this is limited to 1000contacts per call <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/batch_create_or_update>
you'd just need to setup a loop in your code to only process 1000 at a time. That prevents server timeout
ah thank you. is there any other possibilities, such as importing a file? since i need to update millions, it would be quite a lot of api call
hi all, can I send a closed deal information via api so it is reflected in conversion rate report?
Also I don't find it is possible to trigger a workflow via API, is there any other way to trigger workflow via API?

You can also try 3rd party tool <https://www.import2.com/apps/HubSpot|https://www.import2.com/apps/HubSpot> for that tasks (disclaimer I am from Import2)

It can hide the complexity of dealing with api and can work with large volumes
He’s taking about importing a million records at a time, what would that cost be?
We had more of this conversation in another thread so you may have missed that
Pricing is around $1/1,000. But with such volume i would reach out to import2 support and negotiate :)
But eventually Import2 product would still use same api. So number of calls would be the same
good to know this :slightly_smiling_face:
yes <@U011U4MHJ0M> you can set the dealstage and that stage should be set as with winning probability on HubSpot.
You could set up your workflow to trigger when someone is added to a list
